Package com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Interface IFile

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAsset, IIdentifier, Parcelable
    public interface IFile
extends IAsset
    The interface to flat files in Virtuoso.
    Virtuoso can apply several checks to validate a downloaded file:
    1. The observed mime-type matches the expected mime-type.
    2. The observed file size matches the expected file size
    3. The observed file size matches the the content-length advertised by the remote HTTP server

    We strongly encourage you to specify these 'expected' values. If you don't, Virtuoso has no way to guarantee the validity of the downloaded file.
    You can set the expected values when you create a concrete instance of an IFile implementor with IAssetManager.createFileAsset(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).
    See Also:
    Virtuoso

    • Method Detail

      • getFilePath

        String getFilePath()
        The path to the downloaded file on disk.
        Returns:
        The file path. Null if the file hasn't yet been downloaded or is outside of the availability window.

      • getExpectedMimeType

        String getExpectedMimeType()
        The mime-type of this file, which you previously set. Virtuoso uses this value to validate this file during download.
        Returns:
        Expected mime-type of the file
